page.title: 01Sutton-cum-Lound, Lound
page.content: The area contains two small villages called Sutton-cum Lound and Lound surrounded by farm land and grazing land. There is also a place called Tiln. It is mostly grassland with just some houses. There is quite a lot of water which is mainly ash lagoons and gravel pits. The River Idle runs through five of the squares. The river has recently been dug out to improve the drainage of farm land. There are several small woods. There are approximately ten farms and the area is rich with wildlife because the water is good for birds and flowers. The land is very flat. Lots of the roads are unsurfaced and stony and they are not very comfortable to drive a car down.
